most_active_tickets.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App and Plugin Issues on Windows
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Pieces desktop application and Chrome plugin on Windows.  These include pasting images failing with errors, slow performance/lag, and connection problems between the plugin and app.  Some users report outdated plugin messages despite having the latest version.  Troubleshooting steps may include checking network connectivity, updating Pieces OS and the plugin, and ensuring compatibility between versions.

related_issues.title: Pasting images doesn't work.
related_issues.text:
Pasting images doesn't work.
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I paste an image, and I get after a while the "Uuups..." error response. GPT4.1 one tries to read the contents but fails. So pasting doesn't work.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop application is very slow/laggy, not generating any response in copilot chat.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.0.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces desktop application is working very much slow after latest update, takes very much time to give any response. Even after doing a hard reset active runtime, it just do not work. 
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

Failed to connect to PiecesOS

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Chrome plugin doesn't work properly. I can't use the buttons and features, and the sidebar cannot establish connection either. Inside of Pieces desktop app it shows that the chrome plugin is outdated. However this is the newest I got from the chrome app store.

Plugin version: 4.0.9

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop App Performance Issues and Crashes
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing slow performance, unresponsiveness, and crashes in the Pieces desktop app across Windows and macOS. Issues include slow Copilot chat responses, connection problems with the Chrome plugin (version 4.0.9), and crashes specifically when Long Term Memory (L.T.M) 2.5 is enabled.  Troubleshooting steps like hard resets have not resolved the problems. Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and provide solutions.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop keeps crashing
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop keeps crashing
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.4.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I just updated Pieces to try out L.T.M 2.5, and I noticed that the software keeps stopping and restarting on its own. I checked for any updates I may have missed, and none. I restarted the software by forcing it to quit, but the issue persisted. 

The issue only happens when I turn on L.T.M. 
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving issues related to the Pieces desktop application and Chrome plugin on Windows, focusing on image pasting failures, slow performance, and connection problems.
Investigate the root cause of crashes in the Pieces desktop app when L.T.M 2.5 is enabled on macOS.
Improve communication with users regarding plugin updates and compatibility to avoid confusion about outdated plugin messages.
Provide troubleshooting steps or documentation for users experiencing slow performance or connection issues, including checking network connectivity and updating Pieces OS and the plugin.
Consider increasing support resources or prioritizing response times for issues related to the desktop application, given the high activity level on related tickets.
Monitor and track the frequency of reported issues to identify trends and potential areas for improvement in the software itself.
Gather more data on user environments and Pieces OS versions to identify potential compatibility conflicts or system-specific issues contributing to the problems.
Investigate the "Error generating summary" message appearing in multiple bug reports to address the underlying issue with the Gemini Pro model access.
